plagiarism.denyAfterConfirmModalText: Are you sure that you want to change the decision from confirming the plagiarism to denying it? This will delete the corresponding plagiarism case incl. the communication with the student and the verdict and cannot be undone.
plagiarism.warning: Confirmation/Denial of plagiarism will be lost when refreshing the page.
plagiarism.similarityDistributionExplanationTooltip: Distribution of cases identified by the tool. They have to be confirmed manually before further actions can be taken.
plagiarism.similarityThresholdTooltip: Ignore comparisons whose similarity is below this threshold. A similarity of 0% means that there is no overlap between two submissions, a similarity of 50% means that about half of two submissions are identical. A similarity of 100% means that two submissions are completely identical
plagiarism.minimumScoreTooltip: Consider only submissions with a score greater than or equal to this value
plagiarism.minimumSizeTooltip: Consider only submissions whose size is greater or equal to this value
plagiarism.minimumSizeTooltipModeling: Consider only submissions that have at least as many modeling elements as the specified value
plagiarism.minimumSizeTooltipText: Consider only submissions that have at least as many words as the specified value
plagiarism.caution: Plagiarism detection can take a long time for large courses.

confirmDialog.title: Clean up plagiarism comparisons
confirmDialog.question: Are you sure that you want to delete all unused plagiarism comparisons? This cannot be undone.
confirmDialog.warning: ALL plagiarism cases will be deleted including the plagiarism result and run details.

notification.title: Plagiarism Case: {{ exercise }}
notification.body: Dear {{ student }}, after a meticulous review of your final submission for the exercise “{{ exercise }}“ in the course “{{ course }}“, we have concluded that you have committed plagiarism. This is a violation of the [Student Code of Conduct]({{ cocLink }}) of the faculty of computer science that you have agreed upon. The *[Allgemeine Studien- und Prüfungsordnung]({{ aspoLink }})* (General Examination and Study Regulations) regulates consequences for such cases in §22.1. **You have one week to provide a statement about this situation.**

verdict.text: Decide what the consequences of the plagiarism are. The decision can not be reverted.
verdict.plagiarismDescription: Marks this case as plagiarism, or alternatively (if satisfied with the student response) as resolved.
verdict.warningDescription: The student receives the given text as a written warning without any further action.
verdict.pointDeductionDescription: Reduces the amount of points the student achieved in this assignment by the given percentage.
verdict.confirmationText: Are you sure you want to set this verdict? This action cannot be undone.
verdict.studentNotNotified: You must notify the student before determining the verdict.
verdict.alreadyDecided: An instructor already determined a verdict for this plagiarism case.

plagiarismCases.noCourseCases: No plagiarism cases in this course
plagiarismCases.noExamCases: No plagiarism cases in this exam

cases.pageSubtitle: Manage confirmed cases of plagiarism, notify students and assess their statements.
